nodes.text: Garax Hadriin was an officer of the Rebel Alliance who lived during the Galactic Civil War. After the Battle of Yavin, Hadriin was holding the rank of general and commanded a small Rebel Base located on Naboo’s moon of Rori.

Garax Hadriin was a non-player character in the 2003 video game Star Wars Galaxies, a massively multiplayer online role-playing game developed by Sony Online Entertainment and published by LucasArts. The game was shut down on December 15, 2011. Garax Hadriin was added to the game with the fourth chapter of the "Secrets of the Syren" quest line, released with the "Publish 21", on August 4, 2005. The "Secrets of the Syren" story arc was removed from the game with the "Chapter 1", published on June 8, 2006, due to the major changes planed for Rori with the introduction of the Battle of Restuss.

Due to the nature of some characters in Galaxies, Garax Hadriin's appearance was randomized during each server reset. Two known images of Garax Hadriin depict this individual as female. However, one depicts Hadriin as a Mon Calamari, and the other as a Trandoshan. The quest dialogue confirms Hadriin's actual gender to be male.

In the fourth quest of the "Secrets of the Syren" arc, the player had to choose to work with either Rebel Officer Wolff Kalos or Imperial Officer M'Kae. This article assumes that the player was affiliated the Rebel Alliance. During the hunt for Cal Handro and the Syren spice on Rori, Rebel players had to attack an Imperial Base and kill Imperial General Brant Korra in order to collect incriminating evidence against Officer M'Kae. If the player instead chose the Empire, he/she would have to attack General Hadriin's base and kill Garax Hadriin to collect information about Wolff Kalos.
